result.name: fca-financial-promotions-quarterly-data-2022-q3
result.notes:
The FCA analyses the data, from 1 July 2022 to 30 September 2022, resulting from action it has taken against authorised firms breaching financial promotion rules and referrals, and investigations into unregulated activity.

The data the FCA gathers means it can monitor developments in the market, get insights into sectors it has concerns about and act to prevent consumers from harm.

The latest data shows the FCA reviewed 340 financial adverts relating to authorised firms, and its engagement resulted in 4,151 promotions being amended or withdrawn. Retail lending (with 46%), retail investments and retail banking are the sectors with the highest amend/withdraw outcomes, amounting to 95% of the FCA's interventions with authorised firms.

organization.name: financial-conduct-authority
organization.title: Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)
organization.description: The Financial Conduct Authority is the conduct regulator for 59,000 financial services firms and financial markets in the UK and the prudential regulator for over 18,000 of those firms.

result.title: FCA: Financial promotions quarterly data 2022 Q3
